intro: Sciadioseris, commonly known as the false sunflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the sunflower family, Asteraceae. These plants are characterized by their showy, daisy-like flowers with yellow ray florets and a central disk of smaller, tubular flowers. Sciadioseris species are typically herbaceous perennials, often found in arid or semi-arid regions. They have hairy stems and leaves that are usually alternate and lance-shaped. The genus is native to southern Africa, where it thrives in open, sunny habitats.
